Articles.Content:
How did you start gaming? And when did you do this?

I started when I was 2-3 , playing (Sadly) runescape.

Yep, I played runescape at 3.

I\'m not joking at all.

Now you

I started playing where in the world is carman satiago, on my dads old computer, which was dos.

After we got the windows 98 computer, and a few other games, I started playing rollercoster tycoon 2, which me and my sister would get a half hour a day playing, with us doing everything from building theme parks to later on, building prisons and citys (and I still do that to this day). The rollercoaster tycoon 2 disk was later snapped by my brother, much to my anger. I later brought anouther and continued playing, untill my brother started playing it, and stole the disk from me.

After that disk was snapped, I got into playing a rally game, which is still around. The real time that me and gaming took off was when I got my own computer, which was windows 2000. This allowed me to run the original IL-2 which we had gotten 2-4 years earlyer (I got it for christmas). I fell in love with that game, and once again, did stuff that the developer wouldn\'t have thought anyone would do. I did movies, aerobatics, air racing, airshows using the ai, everything that I could.

Sorry for the large amount of info. but there is a story in there, that shows you whats happening with KSP at the moment (I.E they are doing things like submarines, for fun, any idiot that liked the game wouldn\'t try to do that. You have a extremely loyal fanbase.).

Now the next persons story.

First gamed in 1991 in dad\'s laboratory. Tetris, Perestroika, Captain Comic...

In 1994 I got my first job. And that lab had a computer too; with Retaliator and MechWarrior I. Then (in 1997) I applied for a job in another lab having NFS, WarCraft II and Diablo

And only in 1998 I bought my own computer... and really started gaming

I started playing where in the world is carman satiago, on my dads old computer, which was dos.

After we got the windows 98 computer, and a few other games, I started playing rollercoster tycoon 2, which me and my sister would get a half hour a day playing, with us doing everything from building theme parks to later on, building prisons and citys (and I still do that to this day). The rollercoaster tycoon 2 disk was later snapped by my brother, much to my anger. I later brought anouther and continued playing, untill my brother started playing it, and stole the disk from me.

After that disk was snapped, I got into playing a rally game, which is still around. The real time that me and gaming took off was when I got my own computer, which was windows 2000. This allowed me to run the original IL-2 which we had gotten 2-4 years earlyer (I got it for christmas). I fell in love with that game, and once again, did stuff that the developer wouldn\'t have thought anyone would do. I did movies, aerobatics, air racing, airshows using the ai, everything that I could.

Sorry for the large amount of info. but there is a story in there, that shows you whats happening with KSP at the moment (I.E they are doing things like submarines, for fun, any idiot that liked the game wouldn\'t try to do that. You have a extremely loyal fanbase.).

Now the next persons story.

I played rollercoaster tycoon 1, that was a lot of fun at the time.

And what is IL-2?

And @tosh, lucky you.
IL-2 is a ww2 flight sim, and has since its releace been the standard for combat flight sims.

And @tosh, lucky you.
Why? : In Russia we had no personal computers at all when I was 3 =P. Only military and scientific ones...

though I knew an old fart who used to gab he\'d managed to play games even on a CNC machine

I started way back in the late 80s on a ZX Spectrum, or rather its Russian knock-off, Delta. Which may or may not have been an original machine smuggled in from Western Europe and re-labeled. I still have it somewhere, perhaps one day I\'ll take it apart and find out.

That is Turbo Esprit, IMO one of the best games on the platform. If the game seem oddly familiar, it\'s because it\'s effectively an 8-bit GTA. In 1986. On a machine that had a mere 48 kB of memory.

In 1994 I got my first job. And that lab had a computer too; with Retaliator

Daaaamn, I loved that game.

How did you start gaming? And when did you do this?

Accolade Grand Prix Circuit

Sierra/Dynamix Red Baron

Early 90\'s.

commodore 64...Ghost busters...25min wait to load (which wasnt certain if it crashed) been hooked ever since. To this day i play more on Megadrive, Master system, NES, SNES, NeoGEO Home, Wondersawn and N64 games more than i do the modern ones. Usually play on emulators as i dont like getting my orginals out
first gamed Christmas 2001, playstation 2 had just been released. Colin mcrae rally and f1 2001.
When I was two years old my mom taught me how to use her Macintosh Powerbook 1400c and gave me some old floppy disks with my big brother\'s old games on them. I still play them. ;D

I started ACTUALLY getting addicted to games when I started playing MW1.

Then, I played Halo 1-2

Then, I started playing Roblox(Which is sucky now.)

Then, started playing MC.(Still play.)

Then, KSP or Moonbase Alpha...

Then, I played Halo:Reach.

This is how I started gaming .

Used to play old game consoles (SNES I guess?) when I was still young (somewhere in 90\'s). Got a PlayStation and PSOne from abroad, then took a break away from games for many years (around 5 years I guess?) and I was introduced to computers in our computer subject when I was in grade school (I didn\'t knew anything about computers that time ).

Then came Gameboy Advance, and then PlayStation 2. We were fully introduced to the gaming world when we migrated abroad. Many things came at the same time to us all of a sudden (PC games, PSP, GameBoy Advance SP and Micro, PS3, MMORPGs, etc.)

Now I\'m back home, and has a personal computer. Got introduced to Minecraft around May 2011, and here in KSP around October.

My first games were FIFA 06, 7, 8, 9, 10 and a MOTO GP 2006 or so.

Followed by runescape, in 2007.

My first game was Mario 3 or Sonic 2. But what got me into gaming was RangerX for the genesis And then I met Aliens Vs predator 2 for PC , Which led me to BF 1942 - And 1942 had me hooked on PC games

As for Sims my first was FS95 then 2002 , 2004 , IL2 PF , then LOMAC

Currently its IL2 1946 , DCS Blackshark & A-10C .... wait wait wait... KSP should have trackIR support once we have nose cams / cockpit views

Started with N64 Mario games and Combat Flight Simulator 1. Upgraded to CFS 2, and then CFS 3. Discovered Command and Conquer in my dad\'s closet, and he let me try it. Loved it, and proceeded to Red Alert 2. Upgraded to Gamecube, then Wii. Tryed Halo 3 on friend\'s Xbox, and got my own. Found Minecraft, and went back to PC gaming. Got Steam, and PC gaming skyrocketed. Discovered KSP, and here I am.

*snip* and proceeded to Red Alert 2. *snip*

Ahh, The memories

C&C Red Alert 2 music (Hell March 2)

Ahh, The memories

C&C Red Alert 2 music (Hell March 2)

Yes. I always looped that one song during my multiplayer matches, and attempted to synch my attacks with the music. 8)

I think I can complete a timeline

runescape - 2003

Red alert 1 - 2005 ( My Egyptian cousin showed me that one!)

Various - 2007- 2009

Minecraft - 2009

And other stuff

A timeline for me:

2004 - RollerCoaster Tycoon

2005 - Ratchet and Clank

2006 - COD 1 (my dad said it looked just like an action movie!

2007 - RCT3

2007 - Supreme Commander

2008 - Lock On

2009 - COD4

2010 - Orbiter

2011 - KSP

timeline

: More games

2011 : KSP

: Starcraft

: Skyrim

2012 : Garrys mod

: Just Cause 2

Comprehensive and awesome!

I know/played > half those games

I don\'t remember what game it was but when i was like 4 i played the 1st playstation

True story
